Name: Trading Post
Description:
2-6 traders will explore new lands, trade many resources, and experience conflict all while trying to build the greatest trading post! Players try to acquire Land cards, Building cards, and End Game bonuses. to achieve the most victory points and win.

On your turn, roll dice to win land that they have explored, gain resources, trade resources and action/conflict cards, and build blueprints into buildings. At any time during the round they can purchase action or conflict cards.

Name: Final Girl: Lore & Scenario Book – Series 1
Description:
This 64-page staple-bound booklet includes:


     A backstory for each killer in Series 1
     A backstory for each Final Girl in Series 1
     Tips on playing each Final Girl in Series 1
     A scenario for each killer/location combination in Series 1, with special rules and setup instructions for each scenario

Name: Quiz Kids in Ice Cream Land
Description:
Quiz Kids in Ice Cream Land is an educational and entertaining family game. It encourages children's desire to improve their mental ability. The aim is to help children develop their skills in logic and recall. Most children will easily handle 50% of the questions, within their age level. However, since the game is won by the roll of the dice, all players have an equal chance of winning. The player who gets to the end of the track first, wins.

Players roll the dice to determine the number of spaces they will move on the board if they answer their question correctly; the questions are colour-coded into three levels of difficulty according to age.

Includes a plush die, five plush playing pieces, and a cloth game board (all washable) as well as a set of question cards.

Name: Final Girl: Terror from the Grave
Description:
Final Girl Vignette

Some of you've dealt with the birds, now what will you do with the Zombies. Find out in this all-new Vignette Film box that can be played in combination with ANY location! Zombies in Space anyone? Zombies in the Arctic? No, not the poor people of Maple Lane, haven't they been through enough?!?!?!

The Vignette requires both the Core Box and one of the Feature Film Boxes to play the game. The Vignette provides the unique Killer and one Final Girl, and the Feature Film Box provides the Location.

Name: Goetia: Nine Kings of Solomon – Blessed Cherries Promo Tile
Description:
UK Games Expo 2021 promotional Scry Board/Dark Board tile.

Dark Board text: “You sense a Demonic presence! Whilst walking the hallways of UK Games Expo, you can taste the sweetness in the air! It must be the Cherry-Demon who in exchange for some resources will grant you its powers!”

Name: Viceroy: Times of Darkness Promo Cards
Description:
A pack of 10 cards for the 3 modules of the Viceroy: Tides of Darkness Expansion.

There are cards for each of the modules.

Aristocrats Module - 1 Law card
Life Peerage: At end of the game: Copy the lower-section reward of any Aristocrats character in an opponent's pyramid.

Invasion Module - 6 Monsters, 1 Law card

     2 Tier I Monsters: Dragon Kin, Quetzalcoatl
     2 Tier II Monsters: Crystal Golem, Hellrider
     2 Tier III Monsters: Djinn, Ogre


Military Exercise: Each player may immediately combat current monsters. Player's don't get penalty cards in this combat. Don't discard monsters after this combat.

Underworld Module - 1 Law Card
Indulgence: At end of the game: Discard any number of your Bribe Tokens by paying 3 Gemstones for each.

There is also one Character card that can be used with all three modules.
Mistress: 2 Power Points for each token on your combat card.

Name: Director Tecnico Pasion total!
Description:
The game takes place on a tabletop that represents a soccer stadium. The role of each participant is that of Soccer Technical Director and owner of a soccer team. The strategy is applied to the technical direction of the team and a good administration of the franchise to win as many encounters as possible. The more games you win, the more wealth you will be able to generate for your team.

Each season, your team obtains income that will allow you to have sufficient resources to achieve the purchase of the biggest stadium and the players that score the most goals and earn the most profits. Good administration is key because you have to cover the costs and fines to which your Team may be credited. If you run out of resources, you will be disqualified from the tournament.

The challenge is to achieve an optimal balance between sports and administrative decisions to meet the objective of the game and show your opponents that you are the best Soccer Technical Director!



JUEGO DE FUTBOL ESTRATÉGICO Director Técnico DTEl juego se desarrolla en un tablero de mesa que representa un Estadio de FUTBOL. El rol de cada participante es el de DIRECTOR TÉCNICO DT y Dueño de un Equipo de FUTBOL. La estrategia se aplica a la dirección técnica del Equipo y a una buena administración de la franquicia para ganar la mayor cantidad posible de Encuentros. Mientras más partidos ganes, lograrás generar mayor riqueza económica para tu Equipo.

En cada Temporada, tu Equipo obtiene ingresos por diferentes conceptos que te permitirán contar con recursos suficientes para lograr la compra del Estadio de mayor capacidad de espectadores y al Equipo que cuenta con los jugadores que te darán mayor puntuación por cada gol anotado y, a su vez, mayores ganancias. Una buena administración es clave porque deberás cubrir los costos que representan las multas a las que pueda hacerse acreedor tu Equipo, ya que si te quedas sin recursos, serás descalificado del torneo.

El reto está en lograr un balance óptimo entre las decisiones deportivas y las administrativas para cumplir con el objetivo del juego y demostrar a tus contrincantes, ¡que tú eres el mejor Director Técnico del Fútbol. Poner en práctica tus habilidades estratégicas COMO DIRECTOR TÉCNICO DT para ganar la mayor cantidad de Encuentros, generando riqueza económica para comprar la franquicia DEL MUNDO y el Estadio DE LAS ESTRELLAS. Los dos activos más cotizados y rentables del kit de DIRECTOR TÉCNICO DT.

Name: Urlaubsspiel
Description: A typical roll and move type promotional board game. The players take turns to roll and move. They start at home in the upper left corner of the game sheet. The first to reach the travel agency in the center of the game sheet wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

Name: Die ARAG in Europa
Description:
A typical roll and move type promotional board game. The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1. The first to reach the ARAG building in Düsseldorf wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

Game board may be paper or very light, foldable, card stock.

It's the ARAG-Zentrale from the 1960s (Architect: Paul Schneider-Esleben)

Name: Das große HÖRZU-Verkehrsspiel
Description:
A typical roll and move type promotional board game. The players take turns to roll and move. They start at home at the lower left corner of the game map. The first to reach the finish at the upper left corner wins the game. On the paces with traffic signs traffic situations hinder or benefit the players.

Originally publised in HÖR ZU magazine.

Name: Das lustige Würfelspiel: Hol' das Brot vom Bäcker
Description:
A typical roll and move type promotional board game. The players take turns to roll and move. They start at "Start". The first to reach space 17, the bakery,  wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

Likely a 1970s or 1980s publication.

Name: Bärenmarke Almenspiel
Description: Typical roll and move type promotional board game. The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1. The first to reach space 100 wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The rules of the game are integrated in the game board.

Name: Das fröhliche Ferienspiel
Description: The players take turns to roll and move. They start at "Start". On some spaces events cause the players to gain or lose points. Sometimes event cards are drawn. Some of the rules of the game are integrated in the game board. The player with the most points wins the game.

Name: Vom Korn zum Brotgenuss
Description: A typical roll and move type promotional board game. The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space "Start". The first to reach space "Ziel" wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

Name: Multi
Description:
Multi is a simple family card game with the aim of teaching children multiplication.

The game has a number of cards with numbers from 1 to 12 which are factors and more cards with numbers up to 144 which are results. During the game, players have a combination of these in their hand.

On your turn, you may play a result card if there are two factor cards on the table which make up the correct result for your result card and collect all the cards to your score pile. If you can't do this, you have to play a new factor card to the table. After playing, a player's hand is refilled.

The game ends when the draw deck is exhausted.  The payer with the most sets, wins.

There is no publication year stated but the packaging suggests 1940s or 1950s.

Name: Bärenstark
Description:
A typical roll and move type promotional board game. The trip takes place in East Germany and the game was created by the German Communist Party.

The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1. The first to reach space 100 wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The rules of the game are integrated in the game board.

Name: Die Gewürzlandreise
Description: A typical roll and move type promotional board game. The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1. The first to reach space 76 wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

Name: Bloody Retribution: The Battle of Inkerman
Description:
Bloody Retribution: The Battle of Inkerman is a two-player Grand-Tactical level board-wargame of the largest Russian offensive of the Crimean War. Even so, both players have the necessity of both attacking and defending. It uses the alternating-actions system introduced in Paper Wars issue no. 93 Wagram and issue no. 98 Alma games.

The emphasis is on players’ mastery of overall operations rather than the minutiae of tactics. In effect, they role-play the supreme commanders, not the whole chain of command as is common in most complex tactical-level games. It’s a mechanically simpler approach that is at the same time more realistic, given the fact no individual in such situations would have the timely knowledge needed to make detailed decisions.

The battle was personally ordered by the Czar as a final attempt to break the Allied siege lines along Sevastopol’s southern perimeter. The British were initially caught by surprise along the steep slopes of Mount Inkerman. Both sides threw in everything they had available, hoping for a decisive victory. That made for a fierce day of back and forth combat characterized by soldier-level heroism and high-command incompetence. In the end the Russians retreated, but it was a near-run thing that could’ve gone either way.

Each hexagon on the map represents 200 yards (183 meters) from side to opposite side. The units of maneuver are brigades, regiments and battalions. Each full turn represents one or two hours of real time. The first two turns were dominated by dense fog across the whole battlefield; therefore they each represent two hours to take into the account the inescapably slower tempo of operations under such conditions. Artillery is represented abstractly via bombardment markers. There is one full sheet of 228 medium-size (5/8”) iconic counters. Playing time is about three hours, and complexity is low-intermediate.

Published in Paper Wars issue 100

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Fantasy Commander
Description:
Fantasy Commander is a strategic board game set in the fascinating world of Signum, where ancient empires clash with new alliances in epic battles. Here, powerful armies led by seasoned commanders face not only the tactical brilliance of their adversaries but also the unpredictable forces of magic. On the battlefield, monstrous creatures rise to fight alongside legendary heroes blessed by mighty gods, creating a rich tapestry of conflict and adventure.

Originally launched through a successful Kickstarter campaign, Fantasy Commander hit the shelves in November 2023. The core game introduced players to two factions: the Empire of the Undead Styx and the Iron Nest Empire. Since then, exciting expansions have been released, adding two more playable factions—the Blackmarsh Horde and the Underdark, Union of Spider—as well as additional units for the base factions. This ongoing support ensures that the game remains fresh and engaging, with regular updates and new content to explore.

The game features high-quality, highly detailed resin miniatures at a scale of 20mm (1:72), for an exciting gaming experience on the tabletop. Each miniature is crafted with precision, bringing the vibrant characters and terrifying monsters of the Signum world to life.

While Fantasy Commander is primarily designed as a two-player duel, it also offers various modes to set more players. Additionally, players can challenge themselves in a single-player Narrative Campaign, perfect for mastering the fundamental rules of the game while diving deeper into the lore of Signum.

Join the battle and forge your destiny in Fantasy Commander!

Name: Mixed Pickles
Description:
A dexterity party game from the late 19th century comprising sets of wonderful, polished wooden misshapes (the pickles) and a rack's-worth of pointed, wooden handled 'lifting spikes'(!).

Each player receives set of the pickle pieces and two spikes; starting with the Turnip piece, they try and lift the piece into the 'jar' - if they stand up OR drop the piece their turn is over. The first player to drop the turnip in chooses the next piece, all others set their turnips aside for end game penalty scoring.

The rules mention an extra rule for 'Tittups' - pieces that don't seem to exist in any edition this reporter has seen (and I've seen three different editions, one of which removes all mention of Tittups altogether).

Different editions presented in cylindrical, square and octagonal bottles have been confirmed.

—user summary

Name: Cookie Crash
Description:
Cookie Crash you play simultaneously and must recognize color and shape as quickly as possible. In the middle of the table there are drums containing different types of cookies. If you manage to place the correct cookies next to the drum as quickly as possible, you claim the drum.

Each player receives the same number of cookie cards. These are placed under the cookie drum. If cookies do not fit, they go to the discard pile. Each player also has a rolling pin to crush the other player's cookies, a lid to close a drum and a joker cookie to fit each cookie. To win, you must collect as many cookie drum cards as possible. The player with the most cookies in all the drums is the winner.

To make the game a little more difficult, there are 2 upgrades available.

     Secret mission cards
     Forbidden cards.


—description from the designer

Name: Hockey Chess
Description:
A hockey game using 6 chess pieces per side to represent, goalies, Forwards, Defenders, Centers, etc.  Each chess piece has a two-number "skating ability" that it uses to move along the hockey rink as it tries to score a goal, or block an opponent.  The chess pieces move on the rink along lines connected to boxes, so it is a point-to-point movement, in an attempt to get into scoring position.

A game is complete when one team has scored a goal.  A longer version can be played by allowing 12 movement turns per team to complete one period of play with as many goals as can be scored within that 12 move period. After three periods have been completed the game is won by the team with the most goals.

—user summary

Name: Tinners' Trail: Expansions Box
Description:
Contains the Arsenic and Emigration expansions.

Arsenic Expansion
The arsenic expansion adds the extra resource of arsenic. Due to the danger of arsenic, it is mined at the cost of PERMANENTLY losing work points but with the reward of a big cash payout.

Emigration Expansion
In The Emigration expansion, you can send your workers overseas to gain ongoing benefits, such as extra income or free improvements.

Contents:
1 Market board
5 Calciner meeples
20 Arsenic cubes
1 Emigration board
20 Miner meeples (4 per player)
8 Emigration tokens

This was included in the Kickstarter Tinner's Trail Remastered edition.

Name: The BMX Race Game
Description:
A simple roll & move race game with a few opportunities for delay by other players and obstacles on the board. Includes a folding board, dice and 4 standard bicyclist pieces.

—user summary

Name: Reit-Turnier
Description:
Players roll their show jumper over a start-finish course. Along the way, they can encounter squares with events that either set them back or let them advance further. The player who reaches the finish line first wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Necromunda: Underhive – Outcasts Gang Tactics Cards
Description:
This set contains 26 cards for use in Necromunda games.

18 Outcast Gang Cards
8 Blank Fighter Cards

Requires Necromunda Rulebook and Book of the Outcast to use.

Name: Verliebte Jagd
Description:
A game for 2 teenagers in love. One takes the role of the hunter, the other the role of the little bird. After one round, the game is played again with swapped roles.
Both players move their figures by throwing the dice over a start-finish course. At the beginning of the game, the little bird has ducats, which must be paid out to the hunter every now and then. If the ducats run out, the bird must draw and fulfil task cards. These tasks are suitable for impressing shy teenagers from the 1970s. Example: "Dance with me." Whoever has the largest sum of ducats and task cards after both rounds wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Achtung, frecher Frosch!
Description: Players hop their frog by dice roll across a pond of leaves to a field of water lilies to catch a fly and bring it to the finish line. On the way back, a frog may lose its fly to another frog. The first to reach his target field with a fly wins the game.

Name: Space Puppies
Description:
Space Puppies is a deck-building game for 2-5 players.  Each player begins with 5 cards and can take 2 actions per turn: play a dog in front of you, play an action card, save a planet, or discard a card.

Once a player completes a set of dog cards, they choose one of the planets on the dog cards to save, thus earning points.  Play continues in turn order, with each player taking 2 actions per turn.

The endgame trigger is chosen at the beginning of the game; the game can end when someone scores 40 points or when someone has saved 3 planets.

Name: Daddy Issues
Description:
Have you heard the story of the father who "went for cigarettes" and never came back? You play as that guy! The premise is simple: you win the game by getting a pack of cigarettes and returning home in one piece... but that ain't easy when the city is full of dangers, fat pigeons, criminals, and... werewolves?

The dangerous journey can cost you your life... or worse, make you late for your anniversary!

		
		
		
		
		
		
		
		
		

Daddy Issues was created for the 10th BGG Roll & Write contest. It is a highly thematic solo roll & write that combines dark humor, RPG-like narrative, and light management elements. Each run through the city is completely unique, as you roll the dice to explore, fight, and even draw your own map!

		
		
		
		
		
		
		
		
		

You will immerse yourself in a dangerous world of crime and the paranormal. You will be navigating the mean streets day and night while receiving texts from your family and making tough decisions. Time is not on your side, so make every choice count! Trust me, you really don't wanna miss your anniversary!

Name: Tables-Tastic
Description:
Tables-Tastic is a fun family maths game for children aged 6+ that will help children learn their multiplication tables up to 12 x 12 without even realising they are learning.

Players start with a hand of seven cards each and the aim of the game is to be the first player to get rid of all their cards. Each turn starts with the player rolling two dice, giving a number between 2 and 12, and they can play if they have a card in their hand in the correct times table.

Special rules if you roll a 7, 11 or a double add an extra layer of both strategy and luck. Feedback from customers is that the children are so engrossed in trying to work out whether they can play that they don't realise they are learning maths by stealth.

All packs come with "times table checker cards" for children (or adults) who are less confident with their times tables. The game can also be played solo for extra practice.

Name: Agropolis: Seasons
Description:
A 4-card expansion for Agropolis.

Shuffle and deal one additional scoring card from Seasons. When you draw a Seasons card, you must follow the placement rule on your Seasons Scoring Card.

Name: Pōpoki
Description:
OVERVIEW: You are a feral cat trying to leave the abandoned Royal Gardens subdivision on the Big Island of Hawai’i. You will try to make your way over a recent flow field of smooth, glassy pÄhoehoe lava without hurting yourself. If you can make it to Highway 130, then maybe you’ll get picked up and taken to a shelter in the nearby town of Pahoa.

DETAILS: You roll dice to determine the journey the cat will take across lava. Along the way, you draft abilities by playing "akamai" cards. These allow you to change the path of your journeys, to avoid losing life points or whiskers. After six rounds, your score (whiskers multiplied by life points) reflects how well you survived the overall journey.

—description from the designer

Name: 18EUS
Description:
18EUS (Eastern United States) is an 18xx game that features elective personal loans. Players may either take loans to fund lucrative investments or invest in the Bank of New York if they do not have loans. The Bank grows stronger, and loans are worse, when more loans are taken and when someone invests in the Bank.

It also features a highly randomized setup with powerful private companies auctioned over three rounds, incremental capitalization with up to 100% company ownership, and a novel force-buy mechanism.

—description from the designer

Name: Spellslingers Velocity Expansion: Lunar Warrior Luna
Description:
Switch up your gameplay with Luna! This Spellslinger is just as ecstatic to share her powers as she is to switch cards. Keep your opponent guessing with all new card effects—including "Word Wall," which gets stronger the more words your opponent has in their spell's text box—and super protective spells to keep you well in the game!

Velocity Expansions have unique frames, allowing you to shuffle them into and out of any other Spellslingers deck quickly and without issue!

This Velocity Expansion includes 18 new cards! x1 character card x1 lore card x16 spell cards (4 of each type).

Name: Spellslingers Velocity Expansion: Prodigal Sorcerer Kyugen
Description:
Kyugen is back with a vengeance! Arm your deck with 16 new spells, and a new Kyugen character card with an ability that rewards you for playing Legendary and Signature spells! Kyugen has several tools at his disposal to dispatch threats with superior counters, blocking, and card draw, keeping you several steps above any opponent!

Velocity Expansions have unique frames, allowing you to shuffle them into and out of any other Spellslingers deck quickly and without issue!

This Velocity Expansion includes 18 new cards! x1 character card x1 lore card x16 spell cards (4 of each type).

Name: すみっコぐらし おさんぽカードゲーム (Sumikko Gurashi Card Game)
Description:
A game consist of 54 Cards (Can be used as standard poker card).
Most cards show a road on or pavement on it. Join the roads and pavement, first to play all the cards win.
A special placement rule for 8 sets of 3-cards combinations and 4 sets of 2-cards combinations.

Name: Dessert Party
Description:
Designed in Hong Kong.
Players are pâtissiers, gathering fruits in the market to make tasteful pastries. 
The best pâtissier make the highest value and number of pastries.
Strive to be the Best!

Simple Rules:

     Move along the ring-shaped street with shops and supplies yourself with fruit's materials.
     Using 5 identical fruit's material to upgrade to processed fruit. You may have to "borrow" your fellow pâtissiers to aid one's upgrade.
     Produce one of the two requested dessert with your processed fruits. These dessert will act to your points and also give you special abilities to aid your gather/upgrade process.


Be the first to hit the point target and become the best pâtissiers.

There is a point target for different player count.

Name: The Warp: 5/6 Player Expansion
Description:
You can now enjoy even more epic games of The Warp by adding up to 2 extra players! The expansions adds all components for a fifth and sixth player. This way you can enjoy a fully competitive game with 5 or 6 players or you can play the 2 vs 2 vs 2 team mode.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Warp: Alien Pack
Description:
This pack adds 6 new aliens to The Warp for even more replayability. The aliens can be used as Player races, Exiled races or Warp Guardians.

Included aliens:

     Orgu Scientists
     Nera Seers
     Gul Architects
     Vens Enforcers
     Caler Sentinels
     Fal Bounty Hunters


This expansion is also playable with the 5/6 player expansion.
You need the base game to play.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Warp: Arok Undertakers
Description:
The Arok Undertakers were selected by the Kickstarter backers as an exclusive alien for the campaign.

They can be used in 3 different ways:

     Player alien
     Exiled forces
     Warp Guardian


Their power will grant you an additional troop in your supply if you terrashift an area down to the lowest level.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Warp: Culpa Bookmakers
Description:
The Culpa Bookmakers were selected by the Kickstarter backers as an exclusive alien for the campaign.

They can be used in 3 different ways:

     Player alien
     Exiled forces
     Warp Guardian


Their power introduces betting on the result of any combat during the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Case Geld: The Axis Invasion of North America, 1945-46
Description:
This two-player (solitaire adaptable) alternative history mini-monster has two mapsheets and one counter-sheet to cover the bicoastal invasion of North America by the Japanese and Germans (who have already conquered the rest of the world) at the army/corps level and 50 miles per hex. Command is split-sided. The player running the defense of the US west coast against the Japanese invasion there is also running the German east coast invasion, and the player running the US east coast defense against the German invasion there is also running the Japanese west coast invasion. Victory is possible by each of those four commands. Low-intermediate complexity.

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Pocket Pennant Run
Description: Pocket Pennant Run is the only full-fledged baseball simulation that fits in the palm of your hand! Using just a few simple charts and an intuitive multi-point player rating system, teams and players from yesterday and today come to life, performing just like their real-life counterparts. Pocket Pennant Run is simple enough to be learned in minutes, yet steeped in enough strategy and realism to appease even the most experienced tabletop gamers - it’s tabletop baseball like it oughta be!

Name: Alias: Suklaaversio / Chokladutgåva
Description:
The game is to be played in at least two teams, each team consisting of at least two players.

Each player gets two chocolates from the box, and the teams then take turns explaining ALL of the five words on one of the word cards. If the team manages to explain and guess all the words on the card, they get to take one chocolate from the box. If not, they return one chocolate to the box. 
The team that collects the most chocolate gets to eat them in the end.

The box contains the rules, 40 game cards and 32 pieces of milk chocolate.

Name: Happy Hats Beginning Reading Game
Description:
Players journey through the alphabet in this board game, creating 3-letter words along the way and collecting Hat tokens as rewards for successfully creating words."

Each player starts the game with 5 word ending cards.  They spin the spinner and move to a spcace, ahich has a letter that use to begin a word.  If the can spell a word with one or more cards, using the first letter from the board, they get a hat token.

The game is over when all players reach The End. The player who collected the most Hat Tokens during the game is the winner.

Name: Quiz Kids
Description:
Race along the board and be the first to reach the number 100.  Players move by rolling a die and choosing either to move that many places, or gambling to double their movement by answering a question.

There are also spaces where you can jump ahead of your opponents (or slip behind them) based on your trivia knowledge.

With 2880 questions across six topics, this game is aimed at kids between the ages seven and fourteen and has handicap rules to balance the game across ages.

Name: King's: Cards & Creations
Description:
King’s: Cards and Creations is a Tabletop Card Game Engine that uses the customizable Core 135 Creation Card set to make and play different games; each with alternate and/or additional rules - letting players also customize their game play. Players are able, and encouraged, to write and/or draw on their Creation Cards.

The Core release, between website and rule book rules, contains 5 different games; Kingdrin, Minkingi, Fwords, Creca, and Pazuuru.

In Minkingi, 2 (or potentially more) players use Creation Cards to battle on what is known as the Active Field, vying for the most board control by the end of the game. Players take turns placing one of their cards into an open Active Field space, rotated in any direction to fit the orientation of the space, then declaring battles with other spaces. The player who controls the most Active cards at the end of the game, is the winner.

Kingdrin, however, plays completely differently! 2, 3, 4 or even 5 or more players pool their Creation Cards to one pile, then everyone draws 7 cards. Players take turns declaring and playing cards on top of the Ditch, matching different symbols or numbers to the top ditch card, drawing when they can't. Things get intense when players add 'The Kingdrin Speed Rule' card; and turn order is replaced with players playing as fast as they can! The player who runs out of cards first is the winner.

Creca, while similar to Minkingi, is a much deeper dive into player engagement. Deck and drafting construction, Skills and abilities, as well as heavier gearing towards Card Layouts and new Fields. It uses the Active Field as well, but instead players are racing to control the first five Active Cards at the end of a turn. Creca also implements longer player turns, with different steps in each turn, giving players more choices (and hard decisions!) to deduce optimal plays from.

With player made content (on cards or in games), different games running under one engine (and many more in the works!), and expandable content through Card Layouts like Alt Rule Cards, Source Cards, and Token Cards; the potential is actually endless.

—description from the designer

Name: Mandala Stones: Dice Tower 2021 Objective Cards
Description:
A set of 4 extra end of game objective cards labeled #X0 through #X04, giving players new ways to score points!

Part of Pack E from the 2021 Dice Tower Kickstarter.

Name: Asteroid Field X
Description:
In Asteroid Field X, you play as one of four factions mining an inhospitable asteroid belt.  The object of the game is to build and upgrade mining infrastructure to both keep your colony alive and protected and to mine and sell as much precious ore as possible.  The faction that accumulates the most Creschins (money) from their sales will win the game.  However, there is an “X-factor” in play: buried somewhere in the uncharted regions of this asteroid field is a mysterious alien artifact that emits terrifying forms of energy.  It is of great value in this hyper-capitalist world, and of equally great danger.  If you unearth it and manage to transport it back to your base dome, you can sell it to the ore transport ships for an enormous profit.  But given the difficulty of handling it, someone else might steal it before you can accomplish this!

Asteroid Field X is a limited edition game by Zach Horton.  It is based upon a prototype he designed in 1992.  It functions as a prequel to Supernova, an origin story about a civilization’s extractavist excesses, when mining colonies supplied the raw materials to fuel a powerful but fragile empire—before Object X caused their home star to become unstable, leading to the desperate conditions of Supernova.

Players build and upgrade mining infrastructure in order to extract base metals (not very valuable, but needed to manufacture equipment), premium metals (the chief export of the mining colony, but also used to manufacture some items), and volatile compounds (substances needed to maintain your colony such as water and minerals).  Beyond strategizing between the payoffs of these substances, you need to maintain transportation networks to return your ore safely to your base dome.  You may build various other units to be used for sabotage, protection, or direct attacks.  Asteroid Field X makes extensive use of hidden movement, and ships can be equipped with cloaking devices to render their locations invisible to other players.  Many cargo cards offer special capabilities to players who develop and play them.  Some of these are played covertly and revealed anonymously, to often unpredictable results.  Combined, these mechanisms allow players to pursue secret campaigns of sabotage, openly hostile actions, and peaceful diplomacy, often all at once!

After all players have taken their turn, each round ends with a “diplomatic phase” in which players simultaneously manufacture new units, deploy covert cards that will be revealed in the next round, and decide how much ore to sell to the waiting merchant ships.  The base prices of metal ore fluctuate during the game, as they are tied to a semi-randomized timeline of market cards.  The final price that each player receives for their ore, however, is determined by how much total ore is dumped on the market that round by all players.  Thus betting and bluffing play a significant role, as players attempt to manipulate the market to favor their own interests. After 12 rounds (each represented by a Market card), the game ends, with the player who has received the most money declared the winner.

Name: Hook-up Break-up
Description:
In the game of love, there are many obstacles to overcome—from the influence of other people to infidelity. Do you think you have what it takes to make your relationship successful despite temptation and the negative influence of others? Can you overcome those barriers and live with your partner happily ever after?

Hook-up Break-up is a game that focuses on you, your relationship with your partner, and the people around you who will either positively or negatively affect that partnership.

On their turn, players roll the dice. This will determine whether they move forward, backward, draw a card or take action (influence a relationship, use a wild card to his favor or against others)

The winner is the player who reaches the end of the relationship meter before others. It's where he reached the maturity of his relationship and considered married.

Name: Great War Commander: Battle Pack Nr1
Description:
Great War Commander Battle Pack Nr1 is the first of what will be many themed scenario packs for use with the Great War Commander series of games.

This first Battle Pack is focused on the western front with actions opposing the German forces to the US, British, French and even Portuguese troops.

This Battle Pack features 12 new scenarios - one of which is an amphibious assault - as well as a thrilling Verdun campaign.
It also includes 2 stunning new maps and 113 new counters with new units (French Foreign Legion), new tanks (mark I), and new weapons (37mm infantry gun).

—description from the designer

COMPONENTS
Two new maps (maps 23 & 24)
Twelve new Scenarios (see below) 
One Verdun campaign
113 die-cut counters
28 additional counters to correct BEF colorization

Rules for Smoke, Beach terrain and updated Artillery table
The Verdun campaign is played in a series of linked "battles". It portrays the April 1916fights for the Mort Homme and Côte 304.
Map 23 depicts a specific location: Hill60 (accurate to actual trench map)

The scenarios in GWC: BP Nr1 include:


    33 "Étrépilly" French (Zouaves and Chasseurs) vs Germans, 7 September 1914;
    34 "Race to the Bridge" British (Royal Marines) vs Germans, 9 October 1914;
    35 "Garibaldi Legion" French Foreign Legion (Italian volunteers) vs Germans, 26 December 1914;
    36 "Hill 60 Chapter I" British vs Germans, british mining and attack on Hill 60 17 April 1915;
    37 "Hill 60 Chapter II" British vs Germans, german counterattack on Hill 60 18 April 1915;
    38 "Landships" Canadians vs Germans, first appearance of the tanks (Mark I) 15 September 1916;
    39 "Primera Patrulha" Portuguese (CEP) vs Germans, 2 June 1917;
    40 "Operation Hush" British vs Germans, the amphibious assault that never was, August 1917;
    41 "Following the Tanks" Highlanders vs Germans, 20 November 1917;
    42 "Faverolles" French vs Germans, 3 June 1918;
    43 "Guillemont Farm" US vs Germans, 29 September 1918;
    44 "Fast and Frious" US vs Germans,  Sgt York's Medal of Honor, 8 October 1918;


NOTE: GWC:BP Nr1 is not a complete game and requires ownership of both Great War Commander and Great War Commander: BEF to play.

Name: The Teams Courtyard (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
Description:
When the construction of that courtyard was completed, everyone realized that they were part of the same community. Something bigger than the mere sum of their individualities. Something that reunited them with an unprecedented force regardless of their origins, their beliefs, or their social stratum... at that moment they stopped competing and started helping each other,  sharing the infrastructures and resources that this new and beautiful city was offering them.
This commemorative tile was created by Carcassonne.cat for the first online team world championship of Carcassonne on the Boardgamearena platform (WTCOC 2020).

• RULES FOR TILE PLACEMENT: 
This tile is mixed with the rest of the tiles in the game. The player who draws it can place it following the standard rules of the game. Note that the tile has the city on all 4 sides and these are joined at the corners (it's not a dividing tile, it's quite the opposite). 
The city that contains The Teams Courtyard tile will not take into account the regular system of who has the most meeples to designate who wins the points for that city (completed or not).  You only need to have at least 1 meeple in order to get points from that city. The player who plays The Teams Courtyard tile will be able to place an additional farmer in the yard if he wishes to.

Name: Death Ride Normandy: CW Air-Maintenance-Logistics Enhancement
Description:
This enhancement provides Air, Maintenance, and Logistics elements to support the Commonwealth forces in the Normandy campaign.
This enhancement provides the Commonwealth player with the entire II British Tactical Airforce.  Additional maintenance recovery units, supply transport units, and supply units, all spell extra detail that players will appreciate.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Roads of Europe (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
Description:
This mini expansion has been designed by Carcassonne.cat to celebrate the first European (Online) Team Championship. In doing so, we have encapsulated elements of the global Covid-19 pandemic such as the recommendation to use a protective mask to minimize the spread of the virus, and the need for self-isolation among those who may have been in contact with it.
Thus, the meeple with stars between the two roads depicted on the tile symbolizes the geographical context of the championship and the exceptional situation in Europe, and throughout the rest of the world.

Setup

The Roads of Europe tile should be mixed in with the other tiles as usual

How to use the tile

Following the basic rules for laying tiles, proceed as normal according to the following cases.

In 2-player games, promote a more competitive use

When a player draws this tile and places it such that it extends a road (or roads), any meeple(s) occupying these roads must immediately be removed from them without scoring. These meeples have been in contact with the virus and must go home to self-isolate! The active player must then place each removed meeple into separate incomplete and unoccupied cities of his choice, somewhere on the landscape. Meeples may not be moved into any city that is already occupied.
If there are not enough unoccupied cities available to accommodate all removed meeples separately, the active player chooses which meeples to place and which to return to their owner. After all removed meeples have either been moved to cities or returned to their owners, the active player is granted a bonus turn and must draw a new tile and place it according to the usual rules.
If the tile is placed on an unclaimed road (i.e. one without a meeple), it may not be claimed by the active player and no bonus turn is given.
The road may be extended on subsequent turns, but may not be claimed until such time that it is completed. The player that completes the road may choose to claim and score it, as per the usual rules, as long as they have at least one meeple in their supply.

With 3 or more players, promote a more playful and fun use -

The rules for games with more than two players follow the same rules as outlined above for games with two players, but with one exception: when the road is closed, all players who have not closed the road will lose as many points as there are tiles on the road.

Special cases


     While meeples may never be placed as thieves on any of the road segments on the special tile, the fields are safe from the virus and may be claimed according to the usual rules by a meeple as a farmer.



     There may be a situation where the placement of the special tile automatically closes a road. In that case, if there are meeples on it, they would return to their owners and the player who placed the tile would not be able to claim the road and the other players would not lose points either.



     In the case of playing with expansions, all the tiles with special effects would disappear as part of the road expansion before closing. In any case, the tokens could still be used as normal tokens. Example: The mini tunnel expansion contributes to the expansion of the road without adding any special effects, but the princess and the dragon or inns and cathedrals contain symbols that are canceled when they are part of the road.

Name: Flying Colors: Beat to Quarters, Vol II
Description:
Beat to Quarters, Vol II (Serpents of the Seas) is an official expansion to Serpents of the Seas by GMT Games, LLC and requires a copy of that game to play.

One of the most common criticisms of the Flying Colors system is the clutter of status markers on the map and that they may detract from game play. This concern can be minimized somewhat by using status sheets and a handy pencil to keep track of things on paper. This, however, adds a separate record-keeping aspect that the design of the game goes out of its way to avoid.

Beat to Quarters provides the ultimate way by which to keep track of the status of individual ships through the use of individual tracking cards that are kept conveniently near the map and that are laid out to conveniently hold a variety of status markers such as Broadsides Fired, Sail State, Rigging Damage, and Hull Damage. The cards are designed to be printed at a standard 3.5 by 2.5 inch size so that they can be slipped into card protectors for extended usage.

Individual tracking cards are included for all 255 individually named ships included with Serpents of the Seas. But that’s not all!

As a bonus, Beat to Quarters also includes the print-and-play components for an entirely new way to play Serpents of the Seas. Drawing from games such as Naval War, Modern Naval Battles, and (in particular) Enemy in Sight, Beat to Quarters can be played with just the ship tracking cards, a special set of markers and 8.5 x 11 inch tracking board, and the status markers from Serpents of the Seas. The ship cards are organized into squadrons that maneuver and fire against the opposing fleet within a relatively small playing area. With Beat to Quarters, you can play the huge battles without the space requirements for several game maps.

NOTE: This volume of Beat to Quarters only includes marker sheets for the British, French, and American fleets. There are insufficient Spanish, Venetian, and East India Company ships to form a fleet, but these ships can be included in the fleets of the other nationalities as desired or added to the cards from the first volume of Beat to Quarters.

With Beat to Quarters, you can either enhance or completely change your enjoyment of Serpents of the Seas!
Card play modifications to Flying Colors.

—description from the publisher

Name: Nordens ark Familje-Qiuz
Description: In the Nordens Ark Familje-Quiz, everyone, regardless of age, can test their knowledge of animals, nature and the environment. The game includes children's questions for the youngest, junior questions from 8 years and senior questions from 15 years and up. The game is quick and easy. Roll the dice to decide your question. If you answer correctly, you can take an animal badge out of the "secret bag". If the animal on the badge is the same as on the question card, you may take another badge. Who, with the help of knowledge and a little luck, first manages to gather three identical animal badges to win?

Name: Treasures of Olympus
Description:
The Olympian gods are up to their usual mischief, again!  In this Greek mythological game, you'll assume the hidden identity of an Olympian god. Zeus has granted you the ability to wield his Thunderbolts in a Tournament of the gods. You’ll capture mythological creatures as you build an army to command in an epic contest for fame, fortune and most of all, bragging rights in Mt. Olympus. In this mystically veiled bidding and battling game, the god that scores the most points wins.

This is a fun, fast paced action game that is played in three distinct phases, the capture, command and scoring phases. As part of the game, there is a hidden god role card that each player has assumed. Only the gods know when you'll reveal your god identity and how your divine power will be used to enhance your play and stifle others.

In the capture phase, using a bidding style mechanic, you’ll use your limited supply of Thunderbolt tokens to capture mythological creatures from around the table. Gathering information is a key element of this phase because each player will only be allowed to see the creature’s strengths on other players stands. Their own creature card will be on a stand facing away from them and therefore unknown. So, if you surrender, you’ll need to take the lowest strength creature you can see.

After the capture phase, each player will then command their army of mythological creatures one at a time to battle for treasures! This phase is an epic competition for various treasures (gold, armor, valor, temples and worshippers) that only interest the gods. Treasure cards have different point values that range between 1 - 10 and various symbols that are part of your set collections and end game scoring. But be aware that worshippers, the 9 and 10 point value treasure cards, don't have any symbols while the golden Apple, the 1 and 2 point value treasure cards, have a wild symbol that can be used in any one of your set collections.

After all the battling and treasure collecting is done, it’s time to move into the scoring phase and tally up your scores. Unused thunderbolts, treasure cards, set collections (combination of creatures and treasure cards) and any god card bonuses all count towards your grand total. The player, or Olympian god with the most points wins and gets bragging rights in Olympus... for now.

Name: Cuistot Fury
Description:
Cuistot Fury is a competitive team game for 2 to 9 players divided into 2 to 3 brigades of cooks. Their goal: to prepare the best recipes and serve all their customers, in a fierce time trial where every second is precious.

When it's your turn:

     Chose the recipe to prepare. The more complicated the recipe, the more points you get
     Cook as a team


Ingredients and ustensils cards are split between the cooks of the team. Coordinate to make recipes by stacking the cards on the cooking board in the relevant order, before the end of the hourglass!

     Serve the customers


The hourglass helps you put pressure on your competitors, since the faster you are, the less time they have to cook. 
Advanced rules can also add more fun in the competition, with combo mechanisms to serve several customers at the same time, funny challenges for your opponents, and special powers...

Name: Talaref
Description:
Talaref is a trivia game that revisits the 90s and 2000s

The goal is to accumulate the most "refs" (the points in the game) alone or in team, by answering correctly questions on TV shows, music, cinema, news, sports... related to the 90s and 2000s !

When it's your turn, roll the dice. 
If it's a category, answer the question to win the card and the associated "refs". The more difficult the question is, the more refs you get (from 1 to 3). 
The dice can also indicate a challenge. In this case, compete with your friends by proprosing an answer on the topic described on the card, one after the other. The winner can steal a card to its opponent :)

600 cards
900 questions
150 challenges

Name: Darkstar: Tactical Starship Combat in the 26th Century
Description: Darkstar is a tactical war game postulating naval combat in a “science faction” universe set five centuries into a troubled and uncertain future. Players take command of warships serving in the new “black water” navies of reborn empires of old, struggling for control of shipping lanes, resources, and colonies. Ships maneuver and fire in fast-paced combat, with survival not only of the players’ fleets at stake, but perhaps their nation and all of humanity as well.

Name: Family Telly Addicts
Description:
Based on the popular BBC TV show of the 80's and 90's, be the first player to get all four of your Star Tokens around the board and back to your remote control.

Along the way, answer questions to double your move, or take on the "Hoofer Doofer".  Hoofer Doofer squares involve your opponents guessing a TV prgogramme via either an impression, charade or hummed theme tune.

Some tactics take place with up to two of your tokens on the board at any one time, as you have to decide whether to play it safe or risk gifting an opponent an extra move.

Name: babaOrum: Le choc des chefs!
Description:
babaOrum is a board game that plunges you into the world of pastry. To win the clash of the chefs, take your chance and be strategic!

Each player is a baker with a special ability. At the beginning of the game, each player receives an order which is his secret objective and indicates the recipes he has to make to win the game.

Each player is also given face-up recipes that he or she can make.

When it's his turn to play, a player can: 

     First, validate a pastry he prepared in the previous turn if relevant
     Then, try to win recipe, ingredient or action cards, either by betting on luck, or by betting on strategy, or by answering a question about pastry
     Finally, he can play action cards from his hand, or prepare one of his recipes with the ingredient cards he has in his hand. 


The action cards spice up the game, by allowing to exchange or steal cards, to exchange the chefs' special abilities... In short, nothing is won in advance!

As soon as a player has finished preparing the recipes on his secret order, he wins the game!

Name: Sweet Existence: Pleasant Nonsense
Description: In the Pleasant Nonsense expansion pack for the Sweet Existence game, a few things have changed from the Sweet Existence game. Instead of Existence Squares, you’ll have Nonsense Squares that are dreams with unique powers. Perishing is no more. The Consciousness Persists Square is hiding in your Nonsense Squares and prevents you from dreaming so you can’t win. Action Squares multiply chances of mishaps, while Sucrose Sweet Disks make for a sweeter victory. Each game includes 1 of 3 possible mysterious object tokens to track the Active Being. The first being to pay for all 3 Nonsense Squares in front of them wins! It's a marvelous, light-strategy party game for current and budding Strange Planet fans ages 13 and up. —description from the publisher

Name: The Game of Gelato
Description:
The Game of Gelato, also known as 'Il gioco del Gelato', is a card game about gaining ingredients to prepare a quality ice cream: fresh cream, milk, beet sugar, seasonal fruit… Recipe book in hand, the winner is whoever manages to please customers by guessing their favorite flavors.

The box is made up of 110 cards, which are then divided into Customer cards, Ingredient cards and Base Ingredient cards; there is no shortage of recipes and regulations. The deck of customer cards, marked with an ice cream symbol, are to be placed in the center of the table and are revealed during construction to form the "shop". In turn, each player decides whether to prepare an ice cream to serve the customer or to obtain the necessary ingredients. To prepare the ice cream, the player must discard the necessary ingredients from his hand by first checking the recipe in the cookbook. The “wild” cards can replace any ingredient. The more ice cream of customers' favorite flavors the player prepares, the more victory points he earns.

The player with the most points when the deck runs out, wins.

Name: World of Warcraft Unshackled: An Escape Room Box
Description: Will you escape the dangers of Azeroth? You have 60 minutes to break free of the chains that bind and the evils that threaten the World of Warcraft®! Play as honorable members of the Horde and the Alliance and overcome obstacles before time runs out! Stop the spread of Professor Putricide’s plague of undeath in his bizarre laboratory, dodge devilsaurs in Un’Goro Crater, and restore order to Karazhan before the tower collapses! Featuring three different scenarios with three difficulty levels: easy, medium, and challenging. Will you be unshackled? Or will time seal your fate?

Name: Merchants Cove: The Entertainer Crossover Pack
Description:
Assume the role of a fantastical Bard on a journey for fame and glory. Enjoy a unique tempo-dial mechanism in your quest to be the best.

This character is a crossover character with the game Bardwood Grove, and can only be obtained by backing the Bardwood Grove Kickstarter campaign at any level that includes the Spirits of the Grove expansion or as an add-on in the Pledgemanager of the Merchants Cove campaign.

Name: Tin Spin
Description:
Tin Spin is a mix of physical skill, luck, and a bit of strategy. You will split your turns either rolling your die or spinning it, trying to spin longer than your fellow players. It’s a game that comes in a mint tin, making it super compact and easy to bring places, though you will need a table with a hard surface to play on (no playing on carpet, grass, etc…).

The game has 25 gold cubes. The first player to earn 5 of them wins.

You earn cubes using the seven unique dice. Six can go to players (it supports 2-6 players) and the seventh is used to swap dice after each player's turn. It’s rare that you’ll have the same die every turn.

Each die has its strengths and weaknesses, and physical skill at dice spinning makes a difference. It’s surprising how easy it is to learn how to spin dice though. Some dice are more likely to earn you a cube when rolled, some are better at spinning, and you choose each turn to roll or spin. Either way you end your turn by rolling the swap die and doing what it says to swap dice with other players.

Name: Sichere Six
Description:
Sichere Six is the second entry in the "Nein Nine" series of trick-taking card games, and it introduces Fate's Mercy and Mirth.  Players have the opportunity to stick their opponents with the painful penalty cards.  If they feel brave, they can try to collect all of the penalty cards and bring down their opponents' scores even more. Sichere Six begins as a free-for-all.  As the game progresses, temporary partnerships will form, backstabbery will ensue, and only one will escape Fate's game with the victory.

Over the course of no more than nine rounds, players will be trying to collect as many tricks as possible while avoiding dirty tricks that contain 9's.

During each round, the player who first collects a 9 becomes The Chosen and is granted Fate's Mercy. They get to exchange one card with the kitty.  If they are feeling brave enough, they can try to collect all of the 9's and trigger the special scoring known as Fate's Mirth.

The first player to earn 9 points wins the game.  If the game does reach the final round, the player with the highest score wins.

Name: Last Full Measure: The Battle of Gettysburg (Second Edition)
Description:
A new edition of the first Last Full Measure title; Gettysburg with a larger map in size and area covered; new map art and colors; new charts and tables; and new counters.

The Last Full Measure Series is a collection of brigade-level wargames covering battles of the American Civil War. The games use regiments to represent the brigades on the map, and allow them to occupy multiple hexes. LFM is an intermediate rules set that includes cavalry charges, ranged artillery fire, and a simple command system, at a scale 250 yards per hex and 100 men per strength point.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Ramen Chef
Description:
Ramen — for some, it is a brutally delicious noodle soup originally from Japan. For its makers, ramen is the center of an intensely brutal fight in a mega-market. In the metropolis of Tokyo, cooks compete fiercely for the best ingredients so they can satisfy their customers' needs and desires.

In Ramen Chef, you are at the forefront of this battle. Play as one of up to four chefs who run their soup business with sophistication and brains in order to become Tokyo's greatest ramen chef. Your greatest weapon? Your smart head!

Ramen Chef features a literal flip of a classic memory game. You are trying to match ingredients from a 3x3 grid, and collect ingredients that match a secret objective. However, all of the ingredient tiles are double-sided, meaning you need to remember both sides of the tiles in front of you. On your turn, you must verbally state the ingredient you see BEFORE you flip, then flip the tile to reveal the opposite side. If after the second flip, your two tiles (on their opposite sides) now match, you are able to collect one of those tiles for your restaurant and work towards fulfilling your secret objective tile. The player with the most tiles — both ingredients and completed objective tiles— wins.

But be careful! If the opposites sides of your target tiles do not match, you collect nothing, and may leave a combination of tiles that your opponent can now use instead. Surprisingly tactical and shockingly difficult for only nine tiles, Ramen Chef is sure to leave you questioning your memory abilities and hungry for ramen!

—description from the publisher

Name: Roll & Colour: Hearts
Description:
Roll & Colour: Hearts is a two-player game, played on an A5 greeting card. Imagine giving a card that is also a ten-minute game! On the front of the card is a picture, while on the back the rules are laid out neatly.

The aim of the game is to color in the hearts in different colors. One player takes the inside of the hearts, while the other takes the outside. You score points for hearts that are not next to, i.e. that don't fall into the same row and column as, a heart of the same color. To play, lay the card flat on the table. Label the columns 1-3 and the rows 4-6. Next, choose a different color for each roll of the die, so 1 might be red, 2 might be orange, and so on.

On a turn, you roll three dice, then allocate one of the results to a column, one to a row, and one to a color, then fill in a blank heart in that column and row using that color. So if you roll 3, 4, 6, then you could fill a heart in column 3 and row 4 with color 6, or you could fill a heart in column 3 and row 6 with color 4. The game ends when all hearts are colored, and whoever has the most points wins.

Name: Let Sleeping Dons Lie
Description:
In Let Sleeping Dons Lie your goal is to get out of your criminal life with enough loot for a fresh start before the Don wakes up.

As a member of the Don’s crime family, you begin with a hand of 7 cards and some loot. The Don is laid out sleeping in the middle of the play area. Based on how big your crime family is, will determine how much plunder there is to go around.

Each turn you draw a card from either the draw or discard piles.
Then Play a card onto the discard pile, following any actions that may be on the card. When you manage to pick up a total of 7 of one type of plunder, the round ends and the plunder is stashed into Loot bags. Then another round starts. You escape when you are the first to reach enough loot bags for a fresh start.

If the Don wakes up then the game is over and you have to get out with what you loot you can carry.

Name: Karrier
Description:
Karrier is a board game where 3-6 players compete. You need to clean up your dedicated area and reach the sacred altar to win. Get rid of all the trash in your land. Beware, some players can be sneaky. Secretly dump trash in other areas or throw it to opponents’ karriers! Blow others’ Karriers up! Form your own strategy and be the first to take all the honor and reward!

On their turn, players draw and play cards, load trash and move around the board.

The game ends when a player has achieved the goal or when the draw deck runs out of action cards.

The first player to clear the Trash token of their own territory and enter the Sacred Altar with an empty Karrier claims Victory.

Name: Cocktails & Appetizers dice game
Description:
A push your luck dice game of making real Cocktail and Appetizer recipes with cards of real recipes of cocktails and appetizers.

Take 3 random cards, roll the dice to try and roll the "Plate" or "Glass" to start your recipe card then start finding the ingredients you need to finish the recipe card, if you finish a card you can keep the points on the card or you can re-roll the unused dice, but if you don't roll an ingredient you can use you lose all the dice you've collected and no score collected and play passes to the next player.

Play continues until one a player reaches a score of 20.

Name: Little Tokyo
Description:
You've never seen a stacking game with charm like this! Filled with chunky wooden charms featuring the joys of Tokyo, this stacking game challenges players to build two wobbly towers at the same time. Choosing which piece to place next is critical as it may leave your opponent with some of the hardest (and heaviest) pieces for the top of the stack.

In addition to two unique modes of play, you may enjoy keeping these charms as decorations in between games.

Goal of the Game:
Players gradually stack wooden figures with Japanese motifs onto the two "Little Tokyo" Skyline base pieces. If any piece falls or if one of the tower collapses, the player that caused the fall loses a point. The game ends when all pieces have been stacked OR someone has collected three negative points.

—description from the publisher

Name: Nur noch 4 Plätze!
Description:
The players form two teams and take turns to roll and move. Each team controls four pawns. They start at home at space 1 and have to reach the train station at space 35. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

The first team to get four pawns to the train station wins the game.

The game was published just after WWII. It came in an envelope and the meeples consisted of small aluminium cylinders, perhaps leftovers from other productions.

—user summary

Name: Mission: Bathroom Run
Description:
You’re snuggled up warm and drowsy in your bed when it strikes: the need to use the bathroom. If you try to just clench down and ignore it, you could ruin your comfy cozy bed and have to wake up your parents. So you decide to navigate your way past spooky shadows and scary noises to relieve your need so you can get back to bed and finally fall to sleep.

Mission: Bathroom Run is a game for 2 or more players. The only thing required is 1 six-sided die per player and 1 deck of playing cards for every 2 players.  Draw a card, roll a die, and see if you make it to the bathroom!

—description from the designer

Name: Miau-Mäh-Muh!
Description:
On each of 36 cards are 2 to 6 different animals. The cards are laid out face down. The player whose turn it is rolls the dice and tries to uncover a card with the animal on it. If the player succeeds, he may collect the cards that have been revealed so far, or continue rolling the dice and reveal another card. If the player does not succeed, all revealed cards must be turned over again and it is the next player's turn. The player who collects the most cards wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Colt Express: Silk Bandit
Description:
Silk, the new Colt Express bandit…
… For whom you can choose or make up your own power!*

You can choose one of the three following special powers:

     Move power: Move 1 or 2 Cars, whether you are inside the train or on the roof.
     Dodge power: Give to the player of your choice the Neutral Bullet you get when you encounter a Lawman (Marshal or Shotgun) and then change positions as specified in the rulebook. 
     Block power: You block the rear door entrance. No other Character (Bandit or Marshal) can enter that Car through the rear door.


All players must agree on the power of Silk before choosing their Bandit.

—description from the publisher

Name: Funkstille
Description:
The players set up their satellite dishes between the two planets with the spikes pointing at the double lines on their respective spaces. Then the players take turns rolling a die and rotating one of their dishes according to he result of the roll.
The first player to get to align the spikes in a straight line between the planets wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Untamed: Feral Factions – Spirit Strike expansion
Description:
The first expansion to the fast-paced shuffle-building card battle game Untamed Feral Factions,the Spirit Strike expansion adds the Snakes, Gorillas and Deer into the mix, adding new keywords and abilities, and enabling powerful new combos!

Moreover, the Squirrel and Platypus factions are also available to add even MORE variety to your Untamed Feral Factions game!

Content also available in Upgrade KIT: The Upgrade Kit includes the 3 new factions, plus all Spirit Strike Edition content: premium tokens, premium Quick Setup (vac)Tray, and all applicable Stretch Goals and Exclusives.

The original game is needed to to use the expansion or upgrade kit.

Name: Fletter Fuse
Description:
Super-Charge your Word Building But avoid the Fletter Fuse bombs!

In Fletter Fuse, 2-6 players have to fuse Single, Double and Triple letters together to make words. Everyone plays at the same time, so you have to think fast and act faster than your opponents if you want to win. The aim of the game is to make the most points.

Players toss cards with letters into a joint pool.  The first player to see a word of 5 letter or more, shouts the word out and collects the cards.  Once the deck runs out, the cards are added up and the player with the most points wins.

Name: Quindici Giochi con Piero
Description:
A book of 15 small games, some including boards, that were published in remembrance of game designer Piero Cioni.

"In June 2019, a great friend and colleague, Piero Cioni, left us prematurely, and many Italian authors wanted to create this work that, in addition to remembering and paying homage to him, wants to make a small contribution to the organization that has supported him in his latest days and which offers daily assistance to cancer patients and their families: the ANT Foundation.

“In this volume you will find Fifteen Games with Piero. Many times we have found ourselves around a table with Piero, exchanging ideas with him, and we would like to do it again. But Piero is no longer there and so we turned to his games, to the ones we loved most, "talking" with them to create new ones. They are therefore not Piero's games but they are, perhaps, the games that we could have designed together.".


“Nel Giugno del 2019 ci ha prematuramente lasciati un grande amico e collega, Piero Cioni, e molti autori italiani hanno voluto realizzare questa opera che, oltre a ricordarlo ed omaggiarlo, vuole dare un piccolo contributo all’organizzazione che lo ha supportato nei suoi ultimi giorni e che quotidianamente offre assistenza ai malati di tumore e alle loro famiglie: la Fondazione ANT,” scrivono nella prefazione i promotori dell’iniziativa.“In questo volume troverete Quindici Giochi con Piero. Tante volte ci siamo trovati intorno a un tavolo con Piero, a scambiarci idee con lui, e vorremmo farlo ancora. Ma Piero non c’è più e allora ci siamo rivolti ai suoi giochi, a quelli che abbiamo più amato, “parlando” con loro per crearne di nuovi. Non sono quindi giochi “di” Piero ma sono, forse, i giochi che avremmo potuto progettare insieme” concludono.

Name: Chibi Army of Doom
Description:
Once upon a time there was a country where justice reigned, there was no poverty and power was actually in the hands of a capable person. That land was Syntharia, which was ruled by King Rorik. After he died, the country sank into Chaos and a new king have to be found. So the people started a tournament for the best, strongest and wisest people of Syntharia, this tournament is called Chibi Army of Doom.

Chibi Army of Doom is a game in which you can choose one of ten different characters and then have to eliminate all other players in a battle royale tournament. Each character has its own deck consisting of 30 cards and thus individual skills. Tthere are a variety of skills that can be used on opposing turns to protect yourself or to prevent other players from their actions.

Each player chooses a character. Then all player places up to 5 Obstacles from the box on the Table.

Each player takes in turn and resolves all turn effects, draws cards, and takes actions and calculate damage. Each character has 20 life points and is kicked out of the game when it reaches 0. The winner is the last player standing.

Name: Name Dropping
Description:
Name Dropping is the frustratingly fun movie card game. Challenge your friends and family to hours of fast paced fun as you listen to clues to guess the titles of Hollywood's biggest films. Comes with over 300 movie trivia cards, featuring blockbusters, indie films, superhero movies, cult classics, musicals, and much more.

Each Name Dropping card comes with 6 clues, ranked hardest to easiest, that relate to a particular movie, clues include actors/actresses, a quote, and a fun trivia fact, to help you figure out the movie name. Each card also comes with a clue genre, which gives you a snapshot description of the movie, to help guide your guessing.

One team-mate reads the clues, while the rest try to guess the answer as quickly as possible.  If the team guesses correctly, they keep the card and add points.

Name: The Movie Movie Game: Video Game Movie Game
Description: Video Game themed expansion to The Movie Movie Game.

Name: The Movie Movie Game: TV Show Movie-Game
Description: TV Show themed expansion for The Movie Movie Game

Name: Dodos Riding Dinos: Babbey & Kux
Description:
An epic crossover for all backers in the Kickstarter campaign.

Kuxcoatl by artist Tom Babbey from Dragons of the Red Moon has been recreated in the style of Dodos Riding Dinos. This expansion contains a plastic miniature, a wooden meeple and their Dino Rider card.

Name: Dodos Riding Dinos: Mecha Chicken Dinosaur
Description:
Chicken Nicholas joins the race with this mechanical dino. "Mecha Chicken Dimetrodon" is a crossover guest for Dodos riding Dinos and will be a machine that players can build in War for Chicken Island.we

This Expansion includes:
"Oby & The JJJ's" card as a Leader in War for Chicken Island.
Krakatoa & Cannons card as a runner for the Dodo Eggthrone in Dodos riding Dinos.
Mecha Chicken Dimetrodon miniature, compatible with 2 cards for both games, DrD and WFCI.

Name: Großes Mäuserennen durchs Labyrinth
Description: The Players start at the upper right and the lower left corner of the maze und take turns to move their mouse one space per turn. The first player to reach the center of the maze wins the game.

Name: The Towers of the Black Prince (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
Description:
Édouard Plantagenêt, better known as the Black Prince (1330-1376), was the eldest son of Edward III of England and Philippa of Hainaut. The origin of his nickname is uncertain. Some associate it with the colour of his armour; others refer to his reputation for brutality on the battlefield.

The Black Prince's "ride" in 1355 was a devastating raid. In Carcassonne, the upper town (city) remains untouched, but the lower town disappears in flames. In Narbonne, the suburbs, devoid of defences, were destroyed. Retracing his steps, Édouard took the Chemin de Gascogne, set fire to Miremont, destroyed Carbonne, Gimont and returned to his Bordeaux lands without difficulty.

Here, the Black Prince's army is represented by a wooden black tower figure (a black chess rook). The black tower will move around the playing area like the dragon (see Expansion 3 - The Princess & the Dragon), destroying any towers it encounters. It will capture all the followers placed on them.

Towers cannot capture any follower placed on the same tile as the black tower. The black tower cannot be removed from the game even by the dragon.

Name: Incohearent: Fresh Phrases Expansion Pack
Description: Our addicting guess-the-gibberish game just had a baby, and it’s the Incohearent Fresh Phrases Expansion pack. With 180 new gibberish cards to be added to the Incohearent Core game, hilarious game nights are guaranteed. A rotating judge holds a card up so that only they can see the answer, but everyone else sees the Incohearent phrase. Everyone else reads the front of the card aloud. Whoever decodes the phrase first wins the card.

Name: Spray-Spiel
Description:
There are 4 large and 12 small cards, that allow 3 different kinds of play:

- Each player gets a large card. The small cards lie bottom up on the table. The players take turns turning up a card. If the card belongs to the player's large card, he keeps it. Otherwise the card is returned to the table. The first player to get all 3 small cards belonging to his large card wins the game.

- Trump game: A player calls a trump card, f.i. "living room". Now the other players add a fitting card. The last player who is able to do this, collects the played cards and call a new trump card. The player who collects the most card wins the game. This game is played only with the small cards.

- Terzett game: All small cards are dialed among the players, who take turns to draw cards from one another to collect trios. Each player gets a large card to act as a wild card. The player with the most trios wins.

The pictures on the cards illustrate the correct use of aerosol sprays.

Name: デコニファ (Deconifer)
Description:
ãƒ‡ã‚³ãƒ‹ãƒ•ã‚¡ (Deconifer) is a co-operative dexterity game of stacking from Japan. The playing area is a large wooden board showing a fir tree with ribbons, which stands propped up at an angle (much like a stepladder). Players take turns placing toys and gifts on the tree, starting from the bottom and working up.

There are some horizontal lines across sections of the tree. If a gift is placed so that it crosses a line, decorative balls and ribbons can also be hung on the tree. The game ends when a placed object falls from the tree.

At the end of the game, players can work out a score and see how well they did in decorating the tree. If they are careful, they will complete decorating the tree with a Santa and a golden star at the top.

The designer has specialised in highly ornate games made using woodburning techniques. The game features a large number of intricately designed, hand-made pieces, brightly coloured to produce a highly attractive design. As a result, only a few copies are made, and sell for a high price (approx $400). 
user summary

Name: Galaxy Junkers
Description:
Galaxy Junkers is a 2 to 5 player sci-fi strategy game. With excellent replay value, this innovative game is fun for the whole family! Add a new swashbuckling spaceship adventure to your board game collection, and begin your quest to see who can survive the dangers of deep space.

You are galaxy junkers searching for valuable space artifacts from the ruins of an ancient space station. Unfortunately, the wormhole portal collapses, and your ship's engines and power core are severely damaged. You are stranded in deep space. You must salvage the ancient space cubes, power crystals, and power core and use them to escape. Beware: other galaxy junkers are right behind.

Objective: To win, collect the space cubes and power core indicated on your Ship Diagnostic card, and be the first player to reach the center of the wormhole. You may also win by destroying all opposing ships.

Play Time: The play time varies depending on the number of players.

3 Players: 30 minutes, 4 Players: 60-90 minutes, 5 Players: 90-120 minutes

—description from the designer

Name: Press Your Luck Board Game
Description:
Now you can play PRESS YOUR LUCK, the classic TV show, at home with your friends and family. Unfold the scoreboard, write your names, ask each other questions from the cards plus download the free Press Your Luck Appcessory to play the Electronic Big Board! But look out for those nasty Whammies. And speaking of Whammies, this edition includes a fantastic, collectable Plush Whammy!

The game lasts 3 rounds (2 for short game, 4 for long game).  Each round consists of the host reading four question cards to the players.  You will collect three spins if you answer the question correctly and are the first to lay down the answer card.  If you lay down the correct answer card and are not first, you still get one spin.  Zero spins for the wrong answer.  After the question round, you get to play the Big Board and spend your spins.  At any time, you can pass your spins to the next player and make them press their luck!

The winner is whoever survives the Whammys and makes the most money.

Name: BONC!
Description:
BONC! is The Battle Royale Of Card Games, it is a fun, intense, and strategic card game for kids and adults alike.

All players start with 5 lives each. Take turns playing one card face-up on the discard pile.

Try to BONC! the player right before you by matching the number of the card they played.
Or get fancy & use wild cards for special attacks, protection, & healing.

If you lose all your lives, you’re out of the game. The last one standing wins!

—description from the designer

Name: Anabid!: Bid, Spell, and Steal
Description:
In Anabid!, players compete to outspell, outbid and outwit their opponents to achieve the highest score.

After the custom 6- and 8-sided lettered dice are rolled, the first player states a word length and bids how many words that long they think they can spell.  Each subsequent bid must increase the number of words or the word length.

Each player has a scant few seconds to make a bid and each bid is an opportunity to drive the next player to unwisely overbid -- a core strategy.  The top bidder has a minute to fulfil his bid.

Words with greater lengths garner higher scores.  To counter Aunt Edna's dictionary memorization, however, the game includes a clever mechanism that enables a would-be thief to steal the bid score!  After each player has rolled three times (with the middle round in reverse order), the player with the highest score wins!

—description from the publisher
